Generation VII.Sun: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
Generation VII.Moon: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

Generation IX.Scarlet: Using its beak to strike 16 times per second, it opens holes in even the hardest of trees.
Generation IX.Violet: Pikipek has strong muscles in its neck, so it won’t hurt itself even if it violently shakes its head.

Generation VII.Sun: Routes 1 , 4 , 5 , and 6 , Poké Pelago Routes 5 and 8 ( SOS Battle )
Generation VII.Moon: Routes 1 , 4 , 5 , and 6 , Poké Pelago Routes 5 and 8 ( SOS Battle )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Coastal Biome , Torchlit Labyrinth Tera Raid Battles ( 1★ )
